verses.roman:
sarva-saundarya-kānti vaisaye yāṅhāte
sarva-lakṣmī-gaṇera śobhā haya yāṅhā haite

synonyms: sarva-saundarya—of all beauty; kānti—the splendor; vaisaye—sits; yāṅhāte—in whom; sarva-lakṣmī-gaṇera—of all the goddesses of fortune; śobhā—the splendor; haya—is; yāṅhā haite—from whom.
translation: The word "sarva-kānti" indicates that all beauty and luster rest in Her body. All the lakṣmīs derive their beauty from Her.
